caption: I can’t wait for when things open back up and I can enjoy cozy date nights there again. Great drinks and unique bites.

My life is now divided into two parts: before I ate at Bambara, and after. The french toast with passion fruit curd was incredible. The breakfast potatoes are better than they have any right to be. The garlic knots. Oh my God, the garlic knots. I am a better person for having eaten here.
Loved the food! Phenomenal burgers and pork chops. Great atmosphere. Great overall value. We will be back!
Great place! Awesome and delicious! I even forgot to take pictures before eating!
Got there near seven, it wasn't very crowded. The service was very helpful and welcoming. This place has an awesome atmosphere.

My wife and I were looking for an outdoor eating opportunity for Saturday night dinner. We were referred to Bambara by our gourmand and exquisitely tasteful grandson. We implicitly trust his food sensibilities, so off we went after making a reservation, never expecting the gustatory celebration that was to follow. While many have reviewed the quality of the food - worthy of the above 5 star rating - the back story is what intrigued us. The presence of Executive Chef David Bazirgan at this well-hidden secret reminded us of the fable of the Jewel in the Robe, wherein a wealthy man sows a priceless jewel into the hood of his poor and unsuspecting friend's cloak while he slept, and then must leave unexpectedly. Years later, when he finds his friend still impoverished, the wealthy man inquires as to how this could be. Upon discovering the hidden gem, the pauper's life is instantly changed.  While I admit that our dining experience was not quite as earthshaking, it was nonetheless a great surprise to experience one of the best meals we have dined on here in our fair city. And the truly remarkable fact is that for whatever the reason it was one of the most reasonably priced meals we have experienced in Boston - and we dine out not infrequently. We echo Ted Weesner's 2017 Boston Globe review: our dining experience was at the hands of a master chef.  We started with one of the real standouts in the white wine category, a glass of J. Lohr Chardonnay, a fine, well-oaked yet buttery selection chilled to perfection. This was followed by the Choereg bread loaf with honey butter, a sophisticated take on a traditional Armenian Easter bread. Soft, succulent, delightful.  We eschewed any further appetizer distractions and went right to the main courses - an order of the House made Fusilli and the Kutobuta Pork Chop. The pesto and pecorino infused fusilli with snap peas and asparagus was zesty, rich, and complex, and completely enjoyable. The pork chop was thoughtfully complemented with goat cheese grits, a first for me, broccolini - broccoli's much more flavorful cousin, and grilled peaches, the perfect complement to the rich yet not overbearing spicing of the pork.  The sole desert offering, the apricot tart, needed no competition. It was perhaps the best part of the meal. Of course I have a serious sweet tooth, so from that standpoint I am biased.  While we hate like hell to give away our secrets, it is one we simply could not keep to ourselves. We hope you enjoy it as much as we did...we'll be back.

Go-to spot for nice work lunches. The food is delicious and the interior is nice; it's a bit pricey but perfect for a work meeting. My favorites are the grilled cheese and tomato soup, flatbread, and the seasonal salad with salmon plates. After your lunch, they give out complimentary cookies.
Food wasn't half bad but the portion size for the Squash and Ricotta Agnolotti was absurdly small. So small the rest of our party was making jokes about it. Definitely not worth $16.
Never had a bad meal here- soup, salads, sandwiches are great. Only been for lunch, but assuming dinner is just as good
We came here for brunch and we were not impressed with the food. I’m not a picky person when it comes to food, but this food lacked flavor! Everything was very bland. Nice ambiance though.
Safe, boring hotel food with some local and rotating items. Although we ordered various degrees of doneness for our burgers, they were indistinguishable.
I always love coming here, the food is excellent and the people are great. It really is a lovely & very welcoming place. The bar snack happy hour is insanely good value and delicious.
Loved it!! Everything was excellent: the ambiance, the food and drinks. The service was outstanding! Deserves 6 ⭐️  We had the burger 🍔 and the scallops with peas risotto. 😋
Completely overrated place with extremely lousy service and pretty ok food. Just had my brunch here. Won't be going back for sure.
This rating is for brunch. Mediocre. $100 for 3. The oysters had broken bits of shell.
Food is very good here. For dinner, Tried the pork belly bao and the teriyaki chicken wings. Delicious.  Also ate a sandwich for a light snack. Was delicious.

Bland, Ill-prepared food & slow service, just a fail all around.  We were there for brunch with a big group. We ordered a wide assortment, and most everything was either disappointing or almost inedible. The duck confit hash was THE ONLY dish that was considered OK among our group. The French toast was cold, dry & inedible. The Armenian breakfast sandwich was also dry and unpleasant & the salmon ceviche was prepared by someone who has never eaten or seen ceviche in their lives.  Despite the restaurant being pretty empty, we took turns hunting down staff to move our order along - everything took forever. I have a hunch they were short staffed, so I’m willing to give them the benefit of the doubt on that one.  It was quite kid friendly though, with a good assortment of crayons and palatable kid options. The fresh squeezed juice was nice as well. In general, the eggs were well prepared, but I’m really reaching for silver linings at this point.  I rarely give one star reviews, but this was rough.

This place is mediocre for brunch but I was not able to get there for dinner since we stayed at the hotel across the street. I would still recommend this place since the staff and locations were really nice.

Had a department lunch at Bambara in February 2019.  Accommodating staff and affordable items. We had mostly sandwiches and salads which were all tasty and well made. Unfortunately did not get to try the cocktails this go round.  Nothing over the top or imaginative but for a lunch meeting it was what we were looking for.  Note: I am rounding this up from 4.5 due to limitations of the site

First time at Bambara.  I went on a busy Monday night. I happen to be staying at the hotel that's connected to the restaurant and it was a cold, rainy night, so I thoughts I'd stay in.  To sum things up, the food was good, not awesome, but good and the 4 stars were because of Patrick the bartender the night I visited. It was full, so I sat at the bar and was greeted by Patrick who was awesome.  No pushiness and very friendly even on a busy night.  I had a Makers Mark manhattan and checked out the menu.  I eat gluten free, so after browsing my options I settled on an item from the bar menu, the Hanger Steak.  After telling Patrick I was gluten free and knew I couldn't have the Fries, he checked with the kitchen and they'd suggested mashed potatoes.  Good to go. The meal was good, again, not awesome, but good and arrived in the right amount of time.  I appreciated Patrick's friendly help and will return the next time I'm staying nearby.

We held a post-wedding lunchtime reception here in November for about 30 people, and the event turned out great. Management was responsive answering all our questions and accommodating our requests leading up to the event, and everything went well the day of; the staff were all very friendly and on top of everything, and the food was delicious. The price was also reasonable for this type of event. Overall I am extremely pleased with how things turned out and I appreciate the staff at Bambara for making it happen.
Classy, preppy, reliable service and food
Although the quality of the ingredients were excellent. The portions were anemic. I think the actually count the potatoes per serving. Bagel was substandard. Coffee was ok.
Slow service and ok food. There aren't that many good restaurants in this area.
Service and staff were great, food is just okay
Nice place
The food was great. Got the steak and some appetizers. Also the cocktails were amazing.
Good service, food was hot and tasty.

Great dinner. Started with the salmon ceviche, which paired beautifully with the riesling suggested by our waitress. Swordfish entree was cooked perfectly. Will be a regular stop, whenever I am in town.

I came here for dinner after a long day of travel, wanting a place I could relax and work a little. They were accommodating with a quiet place to sit and a wonderful waiter. I ordered something simple that wasn’t on the menu and they were extremely friendly about making it for me. I’m absolutely amazed at their willingness to go above and beyond. I would definitely recommend.
Great food! Great atmosphere! Great staff!
Food was ok, service was slow
Love this place.  Very chic atmosphere and delicious food. Great service.
Good breakfast options
(Translated by Google) Had the lunch fixed price  (Original) Had the lunch prix fixe

Great lunch! My youngest son and I ate at Bambara after visiting the science museum.   It was a quick walk from the museum to Bambara.  It was a nice quiet retreat after the chaos of the museum.   I had the spicy chicken wrap with dressed greens and both were delicious.   I had iced tea with a splash of the pineapple mint lemonade and it was one of the most refreshing beverages ever!  Our waiter brought yummy focaccia bread to nibble on and to-go cookies as a little treat at the end.   I love a meal where I feel like I get everything I want.   This was one of those meals.   Bravo,  Bambara!
Very pricey, no ambiance, burger had too much day globules in it
Room service was incredible!
While in Boston on a conference I went to Bambara for lunch.  The food was great and Yvonne was very attentive and provided an amazing service.  Will definitely be back.  Loved the lamb cavatelli.
Skinny Fries! Good!
The burger (dry aged) was too big and there was on way to finish the fries either. Lemonade was not tasty and free.
Good hotel restaurant. Small menu but the options are made well. A bit pricey but not too bad. Bartenders and servers are friendly.
Had the hammer steak off the bar menu. It was fantastic! Restaurant comfortable and servers personable. I will definitely eat here again.
Awesome spot for lunch. Food is always excellent (I recommend  their burgers) and service is always very good.
One of our favorite restaurants during our visit to Boston!   Staff is so friendly and helpful. We had breakfast, lunch, and dinner and all were delicious!
Perfect lobster roll. Excellent serice

Chopped salad with chicken was excellent with just enough dressing and perfectly grilled and seasoned chicken. Loved the complimentary focaccia bread with olive oil. No brunch menu during the weekday. Seems to be a popular spot for people to drop in for a quick lunch during work, but does not get too crowded.
Excellent food, superb ingredients. Highly recommend or Sunday brunch!
The place looks nice. A bit cramped in the booth area; not enough leg room. The food is  pricey for the serving size you get.
We had a great time. Food was very well done and the service was top notch. Prices are more then reasonable for every high quality restaurant in the area.
Totally under delivered. Not much to say other than portions small, price high, food (filet and potatoes) served cold. Don't waste your time.
Breakfast was phenomenal - had excellent servers and the restaurant manager was great. Nice that it's attached to the Kimpton!

(Translated by Google) Excellent attention I went with my wife and they treated us very well, they looked for a way to make us feel Agusto and the truth was they did it Congratulations  (Original) Excelente atención fui con mi Esposa y nos trataron muy bien buscaron la forma de que nos sintiéramos Agusto y la verdad lo lograron Felicidades
Really good food. Just small portions and expensive. It was also a little quiet in there on a Saturday night. The staff was very friendly and accommodating to all dietary needs
The octopus confit was one of the best dishes I've eaten. Highly recommended.

Nice little resturant associated with the Hotel Marlowe.  Gets a bonus star because it's a place to eat unknown by most of the mall goers at the nearby Cambridgeside galleria--you will often be eating here before you would have been seated at one the in mall chain restaurants.
Classy eatery with decent food at a fairly high price point. Their selection wasn't that good but they offer a nice daily special. I would check the special on their menu before going.
Amazing service every time I sit at the bar with Patrick. Get the Lobster Sliders!! Everything is fantastic!
Nice food, good drinks. Good place to gather for after work drinks.
I really like the food so good nice place  I am enjoyed with my wife today.
Great food! We ordered lobster bisque, clam chowder, lobster roll , fish dishes. All very taste and fresh
Ho hum service. Uninspiring menu.

Taste good, let me start with that. The descriptions are suppose to give a full description of what you're ordering, BUT I guess when it said avocado I was not imagining 5 super tiny Emily poop emoji like drops of avocado on the dish.
elegant restaurant with a big selection of beers and wine. The yuca fry appetizer is really good. great place to meet with colleagues and relax in the sofas area

After hearing so much buzz from this place I was somewhat underwhelmed. Food is standard issue, flatbread, etc. Roasted veggies sounded good but were watery and salty rather than crispy and nutty.   Cocktails were nice but delivered quite slowly.  And the after work bar  crowd was a bunch of shouting tech bros braying over the din of televisions.
Excellent chef- Jay Silva
The breakfast is fairly standard hotel fare: eggs, omlets, and french toast. We didn't find it anything too special, but maybe dinner is better.

Stumbeled on this place during MDW and was very dissapointed!! The sea food is all farm raised and tasteless.. we also ordered a steak and that was undercooked and tiny. Overall poor quality food and high prices. On the other hand service was fair and the ambient was pleasant.

In the evening, you'll find it hard to get a seat at the bar (to perhaps redeem your wine ticket from Hotel Marlowe) and it seems like the bar is a bit understaffed, but once you get your wine, the staff is very friendly and conversational.  I did have breakfast here and they're able to make a fresh omelette with all the sides (toast, veggies and drink) in under 15 minutes: win if you're running late!
Food was excellent. Had the tuna, delicious. Looking forward to going back!
Yellow fin tuna is good. Service is good.

Went there for lunch with coworkers. Enjoyed their lobster bisque and chicken wrap. I would recommend this place for a professional lunch or special night out. Prices are very reasonable for the quality and service.

Didn't have a great experience here. The dish I got was good, not great. The service was terrible. The waiter didn't check on is or refill our drinks from the time we got seated to when we flagged him down for the check. Disappointing.

This is a great place to go if you're looking for lunch with some co-workers.  Their power-lunch menu lets you choose any appetizer plus any entrée for $15. This is great since you can pick what you like and not worry about your meal costing too little or too much.  Overall good food, great atmosphere and great service!
GO ELSEWHERE.
